metadata.title: CVE-2019-16413 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.4. The 9p filesystemdid not protect i_size_write() properly, which causes an i_size_read()infinite loop and denial of service on SMP systems.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16413` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-146-generic - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-lowlatency - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-146-generic - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-146-lowlatency - 4.4.0-146.172
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1044-kvm - 4.4.0-1044.50
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1081-aws - 4.4.0-1081.91
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1056-azure - 4.15.0-1056.61
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1041-gcp - 4.15.0-1041.43
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1022-oracle - 4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1107-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1107.115
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-146.172').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1044.50').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1081.91').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.43').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1107.115').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1111.116').
